poem:
**A Dawn of Debates**

Europe, a sidelong 
gaze—
falling on a stage,
Harris, Trump: the 
dance of futures,
expressions like 
quicksilver,
pity and bemusement, 
fractured 
lightning, 
they feel the pulse, 
rising 
questions in the fog of
morning,
an ally's fate 
whispered 
in the banter—
a shared breath,
uncertain but
alive.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Europe watches Harris-Trump debate for clues on direction US may take The TV debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump was as keenly watched by European diplomats and politicians as by US voters, eager to see who may be next in the White House and – crucially – the direction that a vital ally may next take. One diplomat said they empathised when Harris adopted a series of poses that ranged from pity, bemusement and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
